Message.Msg: We're not unhappy. Only concerned for our friends, family and fellow citizens in harms way. I could not care less what Amazon does short term and long term it will certainly crater as the ponzi that it is. Google postponed its annoucement, but soon enough the Amazon cult will realize its headed for a tragic ending. Google is clearly signalling with Chromebook and the advanced specs that it will outcompete Amazon's consumer value proposition. 100GB Cloud Drive for 2 years with Chromebook. New Nexus 10, probably a price cut on Nexus 7, new Nexus G with a probably price cut on Nexus, all likely to have a strong cloud storage offering and steal content revenues from Amazon... Chromebook with Google Apps will become an increasingly compelling TCO play for small businesses. With its device dominance, Google Now and Shopping will provide a better user experience by aiding local businesses in meeting needs of local customers. It is the future. Amazon's model is dated... Stay strong shorts. This will be a fun ride to 100 (likely lower).

Topic.Title: Skiidady says he lives in New York City, so he will be providing us with regular Hurricane updates

Message.Msg: Kisses, stinky jr.

Message.Title: Impact on weekly options & retailers
Message.Msg: Options: ----------- Looks like option writers will get some free money here. Not only the trading days have been reduced, but I suspect the market to trade flat for the rest of the week. Retailers: ------------ Retailers will win here from the increase sales from people needing to replace what they have lost or got damaged during the storm (whether it be electronics, home improvement stuff, etc). Local retailers will win big first, but some of that will tickle down to increase online sales.

Honestly, I find the entire "it's good because people are going to have to buy more" to be simply disgusting and WILDLY misplaced. Simply stated, there's NOTHING good about millions of people seeing vast amount of property destroyed and being forced to replace that which they otherwise would not have. Whether insured or not, it DESTROYS value and will hurt everyone. The meme that it is good for some segment is typical short term WS #$%$. It will create a significant drain on many families, particularly those with fewer resources to begin with (and those with the highest marginal propensity to consume in the first place). This is bad for all of us, whether we live in the Northeast or anywhere else. It creates a new and unanticipated burden for tens of millions of people. It sucks. Stop trying to frame it as anything else. It's rather distasteful.
AMZN does not trade on moral. Money will simply flow from insurers and saving accounts into retailers. The only retailers to be affected will be luxury good retailers.

Topic.Title: CWTRIPPS: YOU'RE A "WINDBLOWING" SACK OF CRAP:

Message.Msg: All this cwtripps does is take the opposite sentiment of current market conditions. If the market is bullish he's bearish and short and if the market is bearish he's bullish and long. Another joker.

Message.Title: TIC TOC started the RECESSION clock. Big sell off coming looks just like 1937 RECESSION east coast off line 2-3 weeks not good for AMZN
Message.Msg: TIC TOC started the RECESSION clock. Big sell off coming looks just like 1937 RECESSION east coast off line 2-3 weeks not good for AMZN

Techstrategy: "This is bad for all of us, whether we live in the Northeast or anywhere else. It creates a new and unanticipated burden for tens of millions of people. It sucks. Stop trying to frame it as anything else. It's rather distasteful." Boy, is he deranged or what? He is making bets that lots of AMZN longs will lose their money and he criticizes those who are just making objective observations of the storm. What a pathetic soul.

I am decent, compassionate and emphathetic. The only deranged person on this board is you. You are frightened that your bosses will no longer pay you for your pumping because you've lost all credibility on the board. The storm is a tragedy on all levels. Value was destroyed and permanently lost. Amazon will suffer from reduced real purchasing power. In fact, Amazon will suffer more than most as funds will be redirected primarily to Home Depot and Lowes. But, we all lose. Amazon retail longs, get out while they try to keep this pumped for EOM and EOFY. You wil not regret it. This scam is going down...

You are wrong. Amazon is primarily an ECG retailer. That wasn't damaged. Food and shelter was. There will be a shift away from Amazon's strengths to areas where it is relatively weak. Not good at all here. Nonetheless, I find the argument that deadweight loss to society is good to be distasteful coming from parasites like you and GeeGee. Looks as if Jim Cramer may lower himself to your levels tonight...
It will be a much better msg board without this GeeGee idiot...

"GiGi, are you predicting a new high after Cramer's trashing?" What Cramer says has absolutely no bearing on AMZN. AMZN will go sideways in the range 228 and 242 for some time. When enough number of shorts get conditioned to short quick, sharp bounces, she'll suddenly trap them all and go higher. Does it really matter if AMZN hits an all-time high?
All of the "conditioning" has been of the longs so folks like you will catch the daggers. Better you than any of the true retail investors that might check this board...

Topic.Title: NO shopping on AMZN, AMZN is going to be hit big, 8-10 million with out power for up to 2 weeks and 20 million without cell service

Message.Msg: Best Buy etc still matching amazon prices too! And while people have no power...why sit home?? They go out shopping.. the old fashioned way. Stores are no longer "showrooms" for amazon if stores are also matching prices!!! Sorry Bozos. It might be harder for you to destroy american retail than you thought. Third party retailers on your site are catching on to your product poaching scam too!!! Fool me once, shame on you..........

"What Cramer says has absolutely no bearing on AMZN." completely true. Cramer is a loudmouthed fool and need be viewed purely as entertainment (bad entertainment at that) As for the stock... I predict lower. Sandy will take income and time out of discretionary spending and AMZN doesnt have the products that people need to rebuild. Lowes and HD will gain off that.

How is you call this tragedy bad for a stock better than anyone else calling the same event good for the same said stock? We are all drawing conclusions from the same events and yet you are quick to label others' view points as distasteful. Regardless of how you want to see, this event will boost retail. Yes, it will cost individuals and insurance companies, but all that spending will flow into the hands of retail point blank. Now, this might get offset by a slowdown in holiday shopping as people are less jovial and unwilling to spend further, but the short-term effect is a win for retail.

Let's be clear. I call it a tragedy. That's it. Nothing more. I see nothing good about a deadweight loss to society. I see nothing good about people suffering and property being destroyed. I am of the opinion that those trying to pump retail stocks based upon this tragedy are charlatans. I chose to be more specific on the impact for Amazon to clarify that you and GiGi are either exceptionally fuzzy thinkers or charlatans. People will have to replace a lot of product and take on significant new burdens, which will redirect money toward automobiles (look at the damage), industrial/electrical equipment, construction products (wood, drywall, etc). That will shrink the pool of available dollars for discretionary goods, particularly electronics and consumer goods. Retail is not monolithic. Amazon will be hurt by this as will most retailers outside of the few categories which now require replacement. This is value destroying for society (and all that freed up cash will simply be a future tax in the form of higher insurance, taxes, etc...). Get. A. Clue.

Message.Title: Market/Amazon direction uncertain short term
Message.Msg: Bullish factors: while damage was severe, it is managable. Republican candidates appears to be gaining ground, which most investors may welcome. Potential deal or delay of "fiscal cliff". Bearish factors: Cramer has essentially dumped Amazon in favor of Apple. Earnings report was generally poor. Valuation is still excessive. Taxes are rising. Longer term, we should retest the $200-205 area, but hard to say what happens this week. A move above $245 would be a gift horse for bears.

Message.Title: VRNG vs GOOG, Verdict This Week ! Could Take VRNG to Orbit. seeking link
Message.Msg: "VRNG vs GOOG. VERDICT THIS WEEK, Could take VRNG to Orbit" Seeking Link Seeking Alpha Article Vringo: Parabolic Rise Imminent By: Harmohan Parmar October 29, 2012 Disclosure: I am long VRNG. (More...) When examining Vringo's (VRNG) technicals, it looks to be in a bullish state, as can be seen here. Technical analysis aside, the PPS (price per share) of Vringo will be greatly influenced next week by the outcome of its lawsuit against Google (GOOG), IAC Search & Media (IACI), Gannett Company (GCI), Target Corporation (TGT) and AOL (AOL). Developments coming out of court so far suggest Vringo has done an excellent job presenting its case to the court. It seems that Google's lawyers underestimated the risk of going to court and are overpowered by their Vringo counterparts. Dave Manuel defines a parabolic move as, "When a stock starts going up, the buying interest increases dramatically, sending the stock into orbit." Basically, the interest in the stock keeps compounding and growing, triggering a chain react ion. Are we about to witness parabolic movement with the Vringo stock. Verdict for the trial could be announced as early as this week or by the end of the week.

Message.Title: Will Amazon counter bid for Netflix if Microsoft tries to scoop up for xbox live customers!
Message.Msg: I believe Amazon would bid higher then Microsoft would and I wonder if sony has enough money to get in on the bidding, if Microsoft offers all of netflix for free with xbox live fees, it could kill the console war with Sony before it even starts in 2013! Netflix could double in a hurry! If Microsoft was to offer 120 a share. I really believe Amazon would beat it for its Kindle fire. And my gut tells me microsoft would come back with a higher offer. They want this for the new xbox, the reason is it could be the deciding factor between the kid and parents that can't decide to get the kid the new xbox or new playstation that will be out not this christmas but next. If Sony was smart they would bid on Netflix, for the price they could get netflix for, (yes even after a bidding war) they can't build one better with such loyal customers, (and they are loyal) Even Google would have something to gain from Netflix. They could link it right to the google cloud for instance. No doubt in my mind this turns into a bidding war. The average kid will say yeah but with the xbox you get all the netflix movies with the xbox live suscription or something like that. If Sony Playstation does not wake up, they will be saying "what do you mean microsoft is selling 45% more xboxes because Microsoft has Netflix now. Sony would be #$%$, but it will be on them for not thinking, people that play games, also like to sit back with a joint when they are tired of playing gamesand watch a movie, and a lot of these kids just moved out and will spend every last dollar they have on a videogame system and games each month, but they can't afford cable when 90% of what is on they don't want to see anyway. Amazon is smart, netflix ownership for Amazon would mean kindle and movies from Amazon would become the #1choice. Cramer said sell aapl and all but said sell Amazon, I will buy Amazon if it sells off on the cramer talk but will watch aapl fall to 500 and if it breaks 500 maybe 440.

Topic.Title: Will Amazon counter bid for Netflix if Microsoft tries to scoop up for xbox live customers!

Message.Msg: Amazon hardly has the cash to stay in business let alone put out billions for Netflix

Message.Title: amzn - nothing to be excited about
Message.Msg: Revenue missed, earnings missed (posted a loss), fcf falling, expenses going up, competition heating up in every segment, other retailers doing price matching, no competitive advantage to speak of... When this finally falls, it will be epic. They'll be able to salvage some value selling their fancy warehouses below cost to raise some cash (they looooove to sell at cost or below). At that time everyone will be talking about the huge P/E, tiny profits and sometimes losses, hedge funds manipulation, etc. No doubt next Nortel, RIM, Netflix, etc. in the making.
